definition: to fight/to scuffle/to come to blows/CL:場|场[chang2]
dozen (loanword)
to beat/to strike/to hit/to break/to type/to mix up/to build/to fight/to fetch/to make/to tie up/to issue/to shoot/to calculate/to play (a game)/since/from
to support/frame/rack/framework/classifier for planes, large vehicles, radios etc

sentences.english: Frank always gets into brawls at school.
sentences.chinese: 法蘭克經常在學校打架滋事。

sentences.english: You know that angel in the gate custody fight is the most outrageous of?
sentences.chinese: 你們可知道，監護天使在城門口打架是最不像話的？

sentences.english: Some time they fighted, and hurt each other , that'; s not good.
sentences.chinese: 但有時候它們會打架，還傷到對方，這真的是很糟糕。

sentences.english: The young men had nothing better to do than brawl in the streets.
sentences.chinese: 那些年輕人除了在街上打架外沒更好的事幹。

sentences.english: That how do you say that daddy and Niang are fighting?
sentences.chinese: 那你如何說爹爹和娘在打架？

sentences.english: In a fight to save in Bai Yang and lentils.
sentences.chinese: 在一次打架鬥毆中楊林爲了救白文得罪了沈慶和扁豆。

sentences.english: The other boys egged him on fight.
sentences.chinese: 別的孩子攛掇他去打架。

sentences.english: Even to grab channel, include to fight the circumstance of affray has.
sentences.chinese: 甚至爲了搶渠道，包括打架鬥毆的情況都有。

sentences.english: Do you want to fight? Then hold your fist tight!
sentences.chinese: 你想打架嗎？那就捏緊拳頭吧。

sentences.english: "You can only go so far with these fights on your own, " Turner said.
sentences.chinese: “你只能走那麼遠謹此打架，你自己的，”特納說。

sentences.english: Anger provides the difference between a fistfight and a boxing match.
sentences.chinese: 憤怒於打架別於拳擊比賽。

sentences.english: He interposed himself between them to stop them fighting .
sentences.chinese: 他擠進兩人中間，阻止他們打架。

sentences.english: They shared movies, more fights, more cuss words.
sentences.chinese: 讓他們一起看電影，又打架罵髒話了。

sentences.english: In fact, all Greg and I did was fight.
sentences.chinese: 事實上，格瑞格和我所做的就是打架。

sentences.english: Two players got into a fight and were sent to the penalty box for two minutes.
sentences.chinese: 兩名打架的球員被罰到懲罰席上坐二分鐘。

sentences.english: You got yourselves into a lot of fist fights when you were small, and this scar is their legacy.
sentences.chinese: 因爲你小時候太淘氣打架，腿上才留下了這個疤拉。

to be beaten/to take a drubbing/buffeted/knocked about
to have a fist fight/fist fight/brawl
to mediate in a quarrel/to intervene in a dispute and try to calm things down
to quarrel
to take a beating/to get thrashed/to come under attack
to spar/to fight/to duke it out
to cause an accident/to make trouble/to get into trouble

to quarrel/to bicker/glib repartee
to bully
to square off/to exchange blows/to rain blows on sb
to chase and beat
